subject: Programming
title: The DevOps Movement
description: A short lesson to help you apply The DevOps Movement.

hook.text: Developers wrote code. Operations deployed it. They blamed each other when things broke.

buildup.text: DevOps emerged in 2009 to break down the wall between development and operations teams.

discovery.text: Shared responsibility meant the team that built the code also ran it and fixed it in production.

twist.text: Companies renamed their ops teams to 'DevOps teams' and changed nothing. The culture shift was harder.

climax.text: True DevOps is a culture of shared ownership, fast feedback, and continuous improvement.

punchline.text: You build it, you run it, you own it.

quiz.question: What problem does DevOps solve?
options: The wall between development and operations
